name: AIA_ConfusionMatrixColumn
description: Column with recall, precision, and f1
sail_code:
#"SYSTEM_SYSRULES_columnLayout"(
  contents: {
    /*TODO - make reusable rule */
    #"SYSTEM_SYSRULES_richTextDisplayField"(
      accessibilityText: #"urn:appian:translation-string:v1:a0c9eb48-91a3-4624-9d86-1b12e4baa957",
      label: #"urn:appian:translation-string:v1:a0c9eb48-91a3-4624-9d86-1b12e4baa957",
      labelPosition: "JUSTIFIED",
      value: #"SYSTEM_SYSRULES_richTextItem_v1"(
        text: rule!AIA_DisplayPercentage(
          value: ri!recall,
          isPercentage: true
        ),
        color: rule!AIA_PercentageColor(
          value: ri!recall,
          isPercentage: true
        )
      ),
      helpTooltip: "Out of all the extraction values, how many were extracted correctly. Recall is the true positive rate (proportion of extracted values out of values present in the document).

Recall = TP / (TP + FN)"
    ),
    #"SYSTEM_SYSRULES_richTextDisplayField"(
      accessibilityText: #"urn:appian:translation-string:v1:9f801c45-f895-46ab-bc6c-dbd9aa8a3774",
      label: #"urn:appian:translation-string:v1:9f801c45-f895-46ab-bc6c-dbd9aa8a3774",
      labelPosition: "JUSTIFIED",
      value: #"SYSTEM_SYSRULES_richTextItem_v1"(
        text: rule!AIA_DisplayPercentage(
          value: ri!precision,
          isPercentage: true
        ),
        color: rule!AIA_PercentageColor(
          value: ri!precision,
          isPercentage: true
        )
      ),
      helpTooltip: "Out of all the extracted values, how many were actually present in the document. Probability of extracting values accurately out of all values extracted.
Precision = TP / (TP + FP)"
    ),
    #"SYSTEM_SYSRULES_richTextDisplayField"(
      accessibilityText: #"urn:appian:translation-string:v1:30116a10-4dac-49d5-8ea8-3343a07838ed",
      label: #"urn:appian:translation-string:v1:30116a10-4dac-49d5-8ea8-3343a07838ed",
      labelPosition: "JUSTIFIED",
      value: #"SYSTEM_SYSRULES_richTextItem_v1"(
        text: rule!AIA_DisplayPercentage(
          value: ri!f1,
          isPercentage: true
        ),
        color: rule!AIA_PercentageColor(
          value: ri!f1,
          isPercentage: true
        )
      ),
      helpTooltip: "It is difficult to compare two models with low precision and high recall or vice versa. So to make them comparable, we use F-Score. F-score helps to measure Recall and Precision at the same time. It uses Harmonic Mean in place of Arithmetic Mean by punishing the extreme values more. It combines precision and recall as a measure of effectiveness of classification. Lies between 0 and 1. Higher the F-score better the model.

(2 * Recall * Precision) / (Recall + Precision)",

    )
  }
)
